title: Is there an absolute consciousness as Jung claimed? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not a chance. Consciousness is just another body function; try to observe yourself and others, you will see that consciousness - essentially the act of paying attention to signals - serves the purpose of keeping the body alive and intact for as long as possible. All other uses for our consciousness / attention is for amusement purposes only. There is nothing collective about consciousness; each animal has a brain and each brain produces this effect. An unconscious animal cannot survive; consciousness is as prosaic as liver chemistry as they both serve survival.
No. Consciousness cannot be absolute because consciousness is the result of unclarity and clarity. The absolute is clear and beyond any cause and effect.
